meanings.definition: A taxonomic category that ranks below species, usually a fairly permanent geographically isolated race.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study different subspecies to understand how they adapt to their environments.
meanings.sent2: The biologist identified a new subspecies of bird in the rainforest.
meanings.sent3: The subspecies of squirrels in the park had a secret meeting to discuss acorn storage strategies.
meanings.sent4: In the world of cars, the classic model was like a subspecies compared to the modern electric vehicles.
meanings.sent5: The subspecies of flowers in the garden bloomed in a rainbow of colors.

meanings.definition: A group of organisms within a species that differ in minor ways from other members of the species.
meanings.sent1: The zookeeper carefully monitored the subspecies of monkeys to ensure their well-being.
meanings.sent2: The conservationists worked to protect the endangered subspecies of turtles.
meanings.sent3: The subspecies of ants in the kitchen seemed to have a talent for synchronized marching.
meanings.sent4: In the office, the interns formed a subspecies of coffee enthusiasts who always knew the best cafes.
meanings.sent5: The subspecies of butterflies fluttered gracefully in the meadow.
